verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Moses,<WH4872> Yet<WH5750> will I bring<WH935> one<WH259> plague<WH5061> more upon<WH5921> Pharaoh,<WH6547> and upon<WH5921> Egypt;<WH4714> afterwards<WH310> <WH3651> he will let you go<WH7971> hence:<WH4480> <WH2088> when he shall let you go,<WH7971> he shall surely thrust you out<WH1644> <WH1644> <WH853> hence<WH4480> <WH2088> altogether.<WH3617>

Speak <WH1696> now<WH4994> in the ears<WH241> of the people,<WH5971> and let every man<WH376> borrow<WH7592> of<WH4480> <WH854> his neighbor,<WH7453> and every woman<WH802> of<WH4480> <WH854> her neighbor,<WH7468> jewels<WH3627> of silver,<WH3701> and jewels<WH3627> of gold.<WH2091>

And the LORD<WH3068> gave<WH5414> the people<WH5971> <WH853> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of the Egyptians.<WH4714> Moreover<WH1571> the man<WH376> Moses<WH4872> was very<WH3966> great<WH1419> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> in the sight<WH5869> of Pharaoh's<WH6547> servants,<WH5650> and in the sight<WH5869> of the people.<WH5971>
And Moses<WH4872> said,<WH559> Thus<WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> About midnight<WH2676> <WH3915> will I<WH589> go out<WH3318> into the midst<WH8432> of Egypt: <WH4714>

And all<WH3605> the firstborn<WH1060> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> shall die,<WH4191> from the firstborn<WH4480> <WH1060> of Pharaoh<WH6547> that sitteth<WH3427> upon<WH5921> his throne,<WH3678> even unto<WH5704> the firstborn<WH1060> of the maidservant<WH8198> that<WH834> is behind<WH310> the mill;<WH7347> and all<WH3605> the firstborn<WH1060> of beasts.<WH929>

And there shall be<WH1961> a great<WH1419> cry<WH6818> throughout all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> such as<WH834> there was<WH1961> none<WH3808> like it,<WH3644> nor<WH3808> shall be like it<WH3644> any more.<WH3254>

But against any<WH3605> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> shall not<WH3808> a dog<WH3611> move<WH2782> his tongue,<WH3956> against man<WH4480> <WH376> or<WH5704> beast:<WH929> that<WH4616> ye may know<WH3045> how that<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> doth put a difference<WH6395> between<WH996> the Egyptians<WH4714> and Israel.<WH3478>

And all<WH3605> these<WH428> thy servants<WH5650> shall come down<WH3381> unto<WH413> me, and bow down themselves<WH7812> unto me, saying,<WH559> Get thee out,<WH3318> <WH859> and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> that<WH834> follow<WH7272> thee: and after<WH310> that<WH3651> I will go out.<WH3318> And he went out<WH3318> from<WH4480> <WH5973> Pharaoh<WH6547> in a great<WH2750> anger.<WH639>

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Moses,<WH4872> Pharaoh<WH6547> shall not<WH3808> hearken<WH8085> unto<WH413> you; that<WH4616> my wonders<WH4159> may be multiplied<WH7235> in the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> did<WH6213> <WH853> all<WH3605> these<WH428> wonders<WH4159> before<WH6440> Pharaoh:<WH6547> and the LORD<WH3068> hardened<WH2388> <WH853> Pharaoh's<WH6547> heart,<WH3820> so that he would not<WH3808> let<WH853> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> go<WH7971> out of his land.<WH4480> <WH776>
